title: Doctor Feels Production Pressure
summary: Monthly production numbers are below target. Protect clinical integrity: review standards and communication of value, or discuss with leadership for realistic targets.

scene.setting: Monthly production numbers are below target. You may feel anxious or fearful; the hidden risk is fear driving decisions that hurt trust. The decision point is chase numbers vs protect clinical integrity.

beats.narration: The pressure is real. The decision point is push recommendations or review standards and value communication.

dialogue.speaker: doc
dialogue.line: I want to grow production without compromising care—reviewing how we diagnose, present, and communicate value.

choices.label: Increase treatment recommendations more aggressively to meet target.

steps.step: Pivot: case acceptance of needed care, recall and retention, efficiency—not aggressive recommendations.

leader_lines: Fear-driven recommendations can backfire. Let's grow through case acceptance and recall instead.
questions: How do you grow production with integrity?

choices.label: Review diagnosis and treatment standards carefully; improve communication of value.

steps.step: Review diagnosis and treatment standards; identify appropriate cases not fully presented.
One improvement: treatment planning, case presentation, patient education, or recall.

leader_lines: We're protecting integrity. Where can we improve how we communicate value?
What drives production without compromising care?
scripts.closing_line: Standards reviewed; value communication improved; recall and comprehensive care.

choices.label: Reduce appointment time to fit in more patients.

steps.step: Right-sized appointment lengths; efficient systems not shorter visits; patient satisfaction as metric.

leader_lines: Squeezing time can squeeze quality. Let's look at right-sized appointments and efficiency.
How do you balance volume and quality?
questions: What would efficient systems look like?
scripts.closing_line: Right-sized visits; efficient systems; satisfaction as metric.

choices.label: Discuss with leadership: align on realistic targets and support.

steps.step: Request one conversation: realistic targets, timeline, support for case acceptance, clarity on priorities.

leader_lines: I want to align instead of acting from fear. Can we discuss targets and support?
What do you need from leadership?
scripts.closing_line: Realistic targets; support; clarity on priorities.

system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you chase numbers or protect clinical integrity?

outcomes.message: Short-term production may have risen but trust and case acceptance can drop long-term.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with review-standards or discuss-leadership?
How do you grow production with integrity?

outcomes.message: Clinical integrity protected. Long-term trust and production can align.
reflection_questions: Which lever helped most—standards, communication, or leadership dialogue?
How do you sustain integrity under pressure?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I protected clinical integrity under pressure. (1-5)
